goldie showed the penguins how to release new components without having to take them down

kubernetes there are 10 attack vectors in any cluster right from the container down to the network you got to make sure
each one of those 10 layers is fully secured otherwise guess what this gap is security and somebody will get into xcd
and if they are game's over for the cluster they could blow it up so we want to protect that entire vector as much as
possible we do that by using hygiene right security hygiene what is that well
it's a good question is how do i properly hygiene my security model within my containers to properly secure
them by shifting left as much as possible right through that entire life cycle also images
images can be very bloated and very fat and very large an image only a couple of kilobytes but i see them in megabytes
i've even seen in gigabytes believe it or not they're so bloated with drives and libraries you don't need if i'm creating
an application the applications containers you only have within it the libraries the jobs that i need to
run the specific task and nothing else i've seen containers with hp3 drivers in
them an hp 3 printer driver in the container why that's a tech vector for hacker to get
into and expose so when you develop a container you want to have minimum images
anything you don't need take it out do not use it have it shrunk as much as possible if you do that your attack
vector is reduced and that brings you proper computer hygiene also for god's sake please do not your
developers ever download anything from docker hub that's a big no-no right you want to have your own
repository that's fully secured with that you control and only developers can
go to that repository to build on because you know they're hardened right they they're unbloated because you
took out all the drivers and necessary things out of them so you use your foundation anything you
develop is gonna be a pure container that's fully secured and all the hygiene and all the goodness and all the garbage
